Stocks broke down from their six-month-long trading range (see last week’s newsletter for some statistics about how that range had lasted for nearly record time). Once they did, sellers swarmed into the market. There has never been a day like Monday, in that the S&P Index futures were down 140 points and the Dow Jones Industrials were down more than 1,000. Those were intraday numbers, but they literally scared traders of all sorts. 
Fortunately, a strong rally emerged, saving the market from panic liquidations. Even so, there has been extreme volatility for the rest of the week — including the big rally Wednesday. As long as there is this much volatility, one has to respect the fact that there could be a retest of the lows.
